intro: Hypenia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered hypenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Hypenia micrantha is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
